column4: for my 64 bit processor, should i use 64 bit ubuntu or ? as the ubuntu site seems to recommend 32 bit
one more thing, how do i setup wireless network between ubuntu and my win 7 laptop
both are connected to a wireless router
the main thing is, i want to share win7 files in linux and vice-versa

if you have installed samba you can easily browse the win-shares via network in nautilus; if you want to share dirs on your ubuntu-machine for win-machines right-click them and go to "Freigabeoptionen" don't know how this is called in english
let me try it, does any one know the english name for it, btw ?
should be something like "share-options" or similar
in german it's the third entry from the bottom of that context-menu
in german from bottom there are: "Eigenschaften, Senden an, Freigabeoptionen"
so in english it should be: "Properties, Send to, Share...."
but still win7 doesnt see the folder.
did you look for "Workgroup", the samba-shares are in this group
